author: Jana F Brown
title: Endicott Students Contribute to Release of Jailed Conservation Biologist | Endicott College
text: Endicott Students Contribute to Release of Jailed Conservation Biologist On April 7, 2024, Niloufar Bayani was one of four conservationists released from an Iranian prison in a larger amnesty from Iran‚Äôs government. Though her six years of incarceration took place more than 6,000 miles away from the Endicott College campus, Bayani‚Äôs release was not a distant news story; it had a more personal connection. Accused of espionage in 2018 while monitoring the endangered Persian cheetah population near a military facility in Iran, Bayani was originally sentenced to 10 years in prison. Hers was among four cases examined in-depth in a fall 2022 course co-taught by Professor of Politics and International Studies Michael Kilburn and Associate Professor of International Studies Semahagn Abebe. The honors-level Student Advocacy Seminar explored issues of human rights, social justice, global affairs, and civic engagement, and required hands-on research and advocacy on behalf of imprisoned individuals in Iran, Belarus, and Egypt, as identified by [Scholars at Risk](https://www.scholarsatrisk.org/) (SAR), an ‚Äúinternational network of academic institutions organized to support and defend the principles of academic freedom and the human rights of scholars around the world.‚Äù At the start of the semester, the professors assigned student teams to each case. Lauren Rowe ‚Äô24 collaborated with Erin Wood ‚Äô24 and Nathan dos Santos ‚Äô24 to draw attention to Bayani‚Äôs plight. ‚ÄúNo one deserves to experience what she went through,‚Äù Rowe said. Throughout the fall, the trio wrote opinion pieces and sent them to newspapers; drafted letters to environmentalists and others who might be willing to help Bayani (one of Wood‚Äôs was published in the Columbia University student newspaper); and created a QR code linked to a petition to free Bayani. ‚ÄúIt was wonderful to hear about her release and, while our impact was not nearly as big as others,‚Äù Wood said, ‚Äúit was nice to know we played a small role in raising awareness.‚Äù Although there were much larger players in the campaign to secure Bayani‚Äôs release, including SAR and Amnesty International, Wood, Rowe, and dos Santos joined dozens of other college students around the world in promoting the cause. ‚ÄúWe talk about shifting one molecule in the moral universe, and maybe that will create a cascade,‚Äù explained Kilburn, who has been teaching human rights at Endicott for two decades. ‚ÄúThe methodology of writing a letter and asking someone to be released seems na√Øve, but when the pressure adds up and it‚Äôs undergirded by other types of political and economic pressure, it can make a difference, especially to the people who are imprisoned. The worst thing about being in prison is the feeling that you‚Äôre being forgotten.‚Äù Abebe has a personal understanding of the injustices faced by Bayani and other imprisoned scholars. Born in Ethiopia, [he became an outspoken advocate for human rights through academia](/news-events/news/news-articles/2023/11/fighting-for-ethiopia-at-endicott), gaining negative attention from the Ethiopian government. While teaching at Civil Service University, Abebe cautioned against human rights abuses in the criminal justice system. His critical ideas earned written and verbal rebukes from the university president and a warning not to speak out against the government. With his freedom‚Äîand life‚Äîin danger, Abebe applied for sanctuary in 2012 through SAR and landed at Endicott in 2017 after teaching posts at the Irish Center for Human Rights, McGill University, and the University of Connecticut. ‚ÄúDuring election time, 30,000 were in prison for similar [concerns], so I was hiding for weeks,‚Äù Abebe said. ‚ÄúIf not for Scholars at Risk, I would not be here continuing their work.‚Äù While Kilburn and Abebe have co-taught about human rights for five years, Kilburn credited Endicott‚Äôs Provost Sara Quay with proposing the Student Advocacy Seminar. The course is offered annually by SAR, and colleges and universities wishing to teach it can connect with the organization and attach themselves to advocacy campaigns for scholars such as Bayani. When discussing the objectives of the course, Abebe noted the importance of human rights discourse and standing for a cause. ‚ÄúBayani‚Äôs case is an example that we have to hold our hope in humanity and that we can make a difference,‚Äù Abebe said. Rowe shared that her experience with the honors-level class ‚Äúhas allowed me to take learning a step further with action and advocacy.‚ÄùMeanwhile, dos Santos spoke of the campus-wide campaign that he, Wood, and Rowe launched to create awareness of Bayani‚Äôs case. In addition to producing a fact pamphlet, they made a poster outlining the case and hung it outside the Callahan Dining Hall, where they staffed a table to answer questions on Human Rights Outreach Day. The students also created a social media campaign and reached out to influencers who seemed likely to promote Bayani‚Äôs cause. ‚ÄúI was happy to hear about Niloufar Bayani‚Äôs release,‚Äù dos Santos said. ‚ÄúSeeing that a semester‚Äôs worth of work could translate into the real world and have a part in helping someone was important.‚Äù Kilburn said that SAR helps to humanize larger political issues, and he‚Äôs grateful that his students had the opportunity to get a close-up look at some of those issues. He and Abebe hope their students will continue to contemplate their potential as responsible world citizens and their ability to advocate for people and causes. The professors plan to offer the Student Advocacy Seminar again with the knowledge that, although Bayani has been released, there are thousands of scholars with similar stories who remain behind bars. ‚ÄúThis is a win,‚Äù Kilburn said, ‚Äúbut the work has got to continue.‚Äù Photo courtesy of the National Iranian American Council By Topic Subscribe Stay up to date on the latest Endicott news! Share Your News Have news? We would love to hear from you!

author: @cronista
title: ALARMA por TORMENTA nunca antes vista: ESTAS son las REGIONES que deben tomar M√ÅXIMA PRECAUCI√ìN y NO SALIR DE
text:
Alarma por tormenta nunca antes vista: estos son los 11 estados que deben tomar m√°xima precauci√≥n y no salir de sus casas
El Servicio Meteorol√≥gico Nacional lanz√≥ una importante alerta y lista de recomendaciones para combatir el severo fen√≥meno clim√°tico
[Michigan: nevadas hist√≥ricas y vientos peligrosos](#michigan-nevadas-historicas-y-vientos-peligrosos)[Wisconsin: visibilidad reducida y desplazamientos complicados](#wisconsin-visibilidad-reducida-y-desplazamientos-complicados)[Dakota del Sur y Wyoming: estragos en las Colinas Negras](#dakota-del-sur-y-wyoming-estragos-en-las-colinas-negras)[Noreste: Nueva York, Maine y Nuevo Hampshire bajo amenaza](#noreste-nueva-york-maine-y-nuevo-hampshire-bajo-amenaza)[Montana y Kentucky: alertas por nieve y rutas peligrosas](#montana-y-kentucky-alertas-por-nieve-y-rutas-peligrosas)[Sierra Nevada: Nevada y California en alerta](#sierra-nevada-nevada-y-california-en-alerta)
Una intensa [tormenta de invierno](/tools/redirect.php?t=3&i=1334417&s=c4a19225e755070f9be03a2fdd978a8b) est√° causando estragos en el norte de [Estados Unidos](https://www.cronista.com/usa/economia-y-finanzas/adios-a-este-dolar-para-siempre-todos-los-billetes-quedaron-prohibidos-y-no-se-aceptan-mas/), afectando a [millones de personas](https://www.cronista.com/usa/economia-y-finanzas/alerta-jubilaciones-y-seguro-social-el-gobierno-elimino-todos-los-pagos-de-diciembre-para-los-que-no-realizaron-este-tramite/) en once estados debido a nevadas severas, lluvias heladas y condiciones de viaje peligrosas.
Los estados m√°s perjudicados incluyen Michigan, Wisconsin, Dakota del Sur y Wyoming, seg√∫n inform√≥ el Servicio Meteorol√≥gico Nacional (NWS).
[El vino m√°s rico y barato de Walmart que no puede faltar en tu mesa de Navidad cuesta menos de USD 7](/tools/redirect.php?t=3&i=1343345&s=5d697c6bdba3c85b4989b73e7e1b41fa)
[Todos la est√°n buscando | La extra√±a y √∫nica moneda de 25 centavos que est√° valuada en USD 5 millones: c√≥mo identificarla](/tools/redirect.php?t=3&i=1341664&s=a1566f422a16b678718168b92447e3a8)
Michigan: nevadas hist√≥ricas y vientos peligrosos
Michigan enfrenta [acumulaciones de nieve significativas](/tools/redirect.php?t=3&i=1334417&s=c4a19225e755070f9be03a2fdd978a8b) debido al efecto del lago, especialmente en el norte inferior del estado. Condados como Cheboygan, Crawford, Emmet y Otsego est√°n bajo "advertencias de tormenta de invierno" desde la tarde del mi√©rcoles hasta la noche del jueves.
Las nevadas podr√≠an alcanzar entre 20 y 40 cent√≠metros, con cantidades localizadas de hasta 45 cent√≠metros, creando condiciones de viaje extremadamente peligrosas. Los vientos, que podr√≠an alcanzar velocidades de hasta 64 km/h, agravan la situaci√≥n.
Wisconsin: visibilidad reducida y desplazamientos complicados
En Wisconsin, el condado de Iron [est√° bajo una advertencia de tormenta](/tools/redirect.php?t=3&i=1325445&s=f46143ff30a178abea89da80e04504e3) de invierno hasta la medianoche del mi√©rcoles, con nevadas previstas entre 15 y 30 cent√≠metros.
Por su parte, los condados de Ashland y Bayfield enfrentar√°n acumulaciones de 8 a 15 cent√≠metros, afectando los desplazamientos durante las horas pico. La combinaci√≥n de nieve y vientos tambi√©n reduce significativamente la visibilidad en las carreteras.
Dakota del Sur y Wyoming: estragos en las Colinas Negras
En el oeste del pa√≠s, las Colinas Negras de Dakota del Sur y Wyoming est√°n siendo azotadas por nevadas adicionales de hasta 10 cent√≠metros y r√°fagas de viento de hasta 56 km/h.
Estas condiciones est√°n complicando la movilidad y generando riesgos para los [residentes y viajeros](https://www.cronista.com/usa/inmigracion/el-mega-plan-del-gobierno-de-mexico-para-combatir-la-deportacion-masiva-de-estados-unidos-que-complica-a-trump/).
[Adi√≥s al estr√©s para siempre: el alimento milagroso que elimina el cansancio, est√° lleno de col√°geno y ayuda a prevenir el c√°ncer](/tools/redirect.php?t=3&i=1341900&s=0b1e6e997b90632bb1b808ef25c58b85)
Noreste: Nueva York, Maine y Nuevo Hampshire bajo amenaza
En [Nueva York](/tools/redirect.php?t=3&i=1341585&s=c538fc89198b7940d284c95d4c717dfc), el condado de Livingston enfrenta un ["aviso meteorol√≥gico de invierno"](/tools/redirect.php?t=3&i=1343130&s=3c5ed956788f4efbe8ee49bd9adbf44a) hasta el viernes en la madrugada, con acumulaciones previstas de entre 10 y 18 cent√≠metros debido al efecto del lago.
Mientras tanto, en Maine y Nuevo Hampshire, se anticipan lluvias heladas y nevadas ligeras. Las acumulaciones de hielo en las zonas costeras podr√≠an alcanzar hasta 2,5 mil√≠metros, con riesgos de cortes de energ√≠a y caminos resbaladizos.
Montana y Kentucky: alertas por nieve y rutas peligrosas
Montana y Kentucky tambi√©n se enfrentan a [condiciones meteorol√≥gicas adversas](/tools/redirect.php?t=3&i=1312435&s=acf1e64b4ccf3655ce0acc2a3e9c82cf). En el este de Kentucky, las nevadas podr√≠an acumular hasta 8 cent√≠metros en terrenos elevados, dificultando los desplazamientos.
En Montana, condados como Rosebud y Carter esperan nevadas ligeras a moderadas con acumulaciones similares, lo que genera riesgos en puentes y pasos elevados.
Sierra Nevada: Nevada y California en alerta
En el oeste, las √°reas de la Sierra Nevada, incluidas las cercan√≠as del Lago Tahoe, enfrentan nevadas que podr√≠an acumular hasta 25 cent√≠metros en altitudes elevadas.
Los vientos, con r√°fagas de hasta 145 km/h, representan un [peligro adicional](/tools/redirect.php?t=3&i=1325445&s=f46143ff30a178abea89da80e04504e3), ya que podr√≠an derribar √°rboles y l√≠neas el√©ctricas.
[Todos la est√°n buscando | La extra√±a y √∫nica moneda de 25 centavos que est√° valuada en USD 5 millones: c√≥mo identificarla](/tools/redirect.php?t=3&i=1341664&s=a1566f422a16b678718168b92447e3a8)
Recomendaciones ante condiciones extremas
El NWS insta a los residentes de las √°reas afectadas a evitar viajes innecesarios, monitorear [actualizaciones clim√°ticas](/tools/redirect.php?t=3&i=1343130&s=3c5ed956788f4efbe8ee49bd9adbf44a) locales y preparar kits de emergencia con suministros esenciales.
Adem√°s, los viajeros deben mantenerse informados a trav√©s de servicios estatales como el 511 para conocer las condiciones de las carreteras.
Las m√°s le√≠das de Trending
[Latinoam√©rica](/usa/trending/el-pais-latino-que-tiene-la-reserva-de-oro-mas-grande-de-la-region-supera-a-brasil-y-mexico/)
El pa√≠s latino que tiene la reserva de oro m√°s grande de la regi√≥n: supera a Brasil y M√©xico
[Metas](/usa/trending/el-consejo-que-no-falla-de-bill-gates-para-negociar-un-salario-alto-en-las-entrevistas-de-trabajo/)
El consejo que no falla de Bill Gates para negociar un salario alto en las entrevistas de trabajo
Las m√°s le√≠das de El Cronista Estados Unidos
[Gesti√≥n](/usa/economia-y-finanzas/es-oficial-el-gobierno-anuncio-que-cancelara-el-reembolso-de-impuestos-de-todas-estas-personas-por-que-no-cobraran-su-dinero/)
Es oficial | El Gobierno anunci√≥ que cancelar√° el reembolso de impuestos de todas estas personas: por qu√© no cobrar√°n su dinero
[SSA](/usa/economia-y-finanzas/alerta-jubilaciones-y-seguro-social-el-gobierno-elimino-todos-los-pagos-de-diciembre-para-los-que-no-realizaron-este-tramite/)
Alerta jubilaciones y seguro social: el Gobierno elimin√≥ todos los pagos de diciembre para los que no realizaron este tr√°mite
[Descubrimiento](/usa/ciencia-salud/el-increible-hallazgo-arqueologico-que-lo-cambia-todo-encontraron-la-verdadera-fuente-del-agua-de-la-vida/)

author: ansa.it
title: I Colli Euganei conquistano l'Unesco - Ultima ora - Ansa.it
text: "E' una grande giornata per i nostri Colli Euganei: oggi hanno conquistato il riconoscimento Unesco. Sono stati iscritti nella Lista delle Riserve Mondiali della Biodiversit√†: luoghi esemplari in cui lo sviluppo economico, sociale e culturale √® sostenibile e trae giovamento dal rispetto dell'ecosistema e della biodiversit√†". Cos√¨ il presidente della Regione del Veneto Luca Zaia annuncia l'esito dell'incontro del Consiglio intergovernativo dell'Unesco riunito in questi giorni ad Agadir in Marocco, che ha decretato l'iscrizione del sito veneto dei Colli Euganei nella Lista Mab dell'Unesco. La decisione √® stata presa all'unanimit√† dai delegati dei 35 Stati membri del Consiglio intergovernativo in rappresentanza degli oltre 180 Stati parte del programma Mab dell'Unesco. La rete delle Riserve mondiali Mab Unesco si compone di 748 siti in tutto il mondo di cui 20 in Italia. Sono luoghi vivi e unici al mondo, in cui √® possibile assicurare uno sviluppo eco-compatibile e un ambiente vivibile in un contesto globale caratterizzato da processi di rapida urbanizzazione e di eccessivo consumo energetico considerati come fattori scatenanti dei cambiamenti climatici. Con il risultato di oggi, il Veneto arriva a 18 riconoscimenti Unesco conquistando il record nazionale: 9 siti patrimonio materiale (da Venezia a Verona, da Vicenza a Padova, dalle Dolomiti a Conegliano e Valdobbiadene, dai siti palafitticoli alle opere di difesa veneziane), 5 patrimoni immateriali (Arte delle perle di vetro, Tocat√¨, Transumanza, Muretti a secco, Opera lirica), 4 riserve Mab (Po Grande, Delta del Po, Monte Grappa, Colli Euganei). Per i Colli ora si aprono nuovi scenari, siamo pronti ad un grande progetto di promozione e sviluppo. "La candidatura dei Colli Euganei √® stata avanzata a settembre 2023 dal presidente del Comitato Nazionale Mab Unesco, professor Pier Luigi Petrillo che ringrazio - ricorda il presidente Zaia -. Nel documento si evidenziavano le caratteristiche dei Colli Euganei che vantano un paesaggio spettacolare caratterizzato da un gruppo di 81 pittoresche colline vulcaniche di altezza variabile da 300 metri a 600 metri nella Pianura Padovano-Veneta a sud-ovest della citt√† di Padova, tra cui il Monte Venda, la collina pi√π alta della regione, oltre a centri termali e a una rigogliosa pianura agricola con numerosi uliveti e vigneti. Il dossier, promosso dal Parco regionale dei Colli Euganei, √® stato seguito passo dopo passo dalla regione Veneto che ha sempre creduto in questo progetto". Riproduzione riservata ¬© Copyright ANSA

author: Brieanna Charlebois; The Canadian Press
title: B.C. civil lawsuit against Sex Pistols guitarist alleges 1980 sexual assault
text:
VANCOUVER ‚Äî A Vancouver woman has filed a civil lawsuit against Paramount Pictures Corp. and punk rocker Stephen Jones of The Sex Pistols alleging he sexually assaulted her as a teenager while she was a movie extra more than 40 years ago.
A B.C. Supreme Court statement of claim filed by the plaintiff says she was 14 years old and working on the movie "Ladies & Gentlemen, The Fabulous Stains" when Jones supplied her with marijuana, then sexually assaulted her in his hotel room.
The court has placed a publication ban on the woman's name.
Her lawyer Jason Gratl said in an interview that he could not comment about why the lawsuit was brought 44 years after the alleged events.
"I only wanted to say one thing and it's that she kept a diary," Gratl said.
The notice of claim filed Wednesday says Paramount didn't take adequate steps to warn minors or their parents about the risks of working on the set with Jonesor impose contractual terms restricting his contact with young extras or using illicit drugs.
None of the allegations have been tested in court.
Paramount did not immediately return a request for comment. Jones could not be reached for comment.
Neither Paramount, nor Jones have filed a statement of defence.
The lawsuit says Paramount hired Jones, who was 24 at the time, for a role in the film because of his reputation as a "punk rocker" who consumed excessive amounts of drugs and alcohol, and engaged in sexual misconduct, including with underage girls.
"The defendant Paramount was banking on the defendant Jones‚Äô reputation and history to market 'The Fabulous Stains,'" the statement says, adding the company "also hired other well-known punk rock musicians as actors for the same purpose."
The statement says that despite this knowledge, the company did not take steps to protect young workers.
The movie, about disaffected teens in a punk rock band, was released in 1982.
The legal action says the woman is seeking damages, claiming the alleged assault "caused her to suffer psychological injury, including loss of self-esteem, loss of self-worth, injurious self-imaging and identity, and loss of trust in intimacy and potential partners."
The lawsuit says she was hired as one of the hundreds of extras playing fans for the all-girl feminist rock band. Jones had been hired to play the role of a "socially volatile punk rock guitar player in a fictitious all-male band, The Looters."
It says that on April 13, 1980, the teen went to the Denman Inn, "a location under the direction and control" of Paramount, with the intention of inviting the movie's lead actor, Diane Lane, to go roller skating.
When she entered the lobby, it says Jones approached her, told her he had Lane's number in his hotel room and asked her to go with him to get it. Once they were inside his room, it says Jones gave her marijuana, and he then turned off the lights and closed the curtains.
The document says she understood that meant he was likely to make sexual advances, she told Jones she did not consent and was "only 14, 1-4." It says despite this, he pulled her onto his bed, climbed on top of her then kissed and molested her.
"The plaintiff repeatedly and expressly told the defendant Jones 'no' and tried to move his hand away, and finally wriggled free from him and left the room," the notice of claim says.
The lawsuit says she was initially "both repulsed and flattered by this unwanted sexual attention from someone she believed to be a rock star and movie star."
Because she was confused by what had happened, the document says she did not tell her parents and it wasn't until she was older that she "felt sexually violated and sexually ashamed and angry" about the alleged assault.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published April 25, 2024.
Brieanna Charlebois, The Canadian Press

author: Focus on the Family
title: Creating Meaningful Mealtimes
text:
Ryan and Lana Rush share practical ways parents can create meaningful mealtimes with their children, to nourish them physically and spiritually. Mealtimes give Christians an opportunity to not only build up their own family, but also to invite others to the table who are outside of their typical circle and show them the love of Christ
Receive Restore the Table and the audio download of the broadcast "Creating Meaningful Mealtimes" for your donation of any amount!
If you've listened to any of our podcasts, please give us your feedback.

author: Careers Desk
title: 1 in 5 IT employees are uncertain about their job stability: Report
text:
It also shed light on the issue of 'employee burnout' which 29 per cent of total employees in 2024 faced in the IT sector. By: Careers Desk New Delhi | November 29, 2024 16:50 IST 2 min read The report reveals a 3 per cent decline in employee engagement among Gen Z workers particularly in the IT sector, signaling growing challenges in connecting with younger employees (Image: AI generated) One in every five IT employees is questioning their job stability, reflecting growing concerns within the workforce, claims a report by Great Place To Work titled ‚ÄòIndia Best Workplaces in IT and IT-BPM 2024‚Äô.
The report reveals a three per cent decline in employee engagement among Gen Z workers particularly in the IT sector , signaling growing challenges in connecting with younger employees who are increasingly prioritising purpose-driven work and a strong sense of community.
This shift emphasises the evolving expectations of this generation, who seek workplaces that offer more than just a paycheck. To address these changes, IT companies must focus on fostering trust, transparency, and meaningful involvement to improve engagement and retain top Gen Z talent, claims the report.
Advertisement READ | Gen Z professionals prefer consulting GenAI over their managers: UpGrad report Here are some of the best workplaces for IT recognised for their exceptional culture and employee satisfaction, listed in no particular order:
Large Size Organisations: ‚ÄìAdobe
‚Äì Infosys Limited
‚ÄìAccenture Solutions Private Limited
SME: ‚ÄìPitney Bowes India Private Limited
‚ÄìAdmiral India
‚ÄìF5 Networks Innovation Private Limited
The report highlights that successful companies are focusing more on transparency, communication, and implementing fair compensation practices. It also shed light on the issue of ‚Äôemployee burnout‚Äô which 29 per cent of total employees in 2024 faced in the IT sector.
Advertisement IT companies that are actively investing in improving flexibility, fostering involvement in decision-making, and offering a better work-life balance are seeing positive results. These organisations are not only reducing burnout but are also boosting employee satisfaction, leading to higher retention rates and stronger morale.
READ | FMCG top recruiter for freshers, Bengaluru leads in hiring: Career Outlook Report In these challenging times, organisations that focus on building trust, enhancing employee engagement, and providing a sense of purpose are emerging stronger. Those excelling in these areas, particularly in sectors like IT and IT-enabled services (ITES), are successfully navigating the evolving landscape of the industry.

title: Russia-Ukraine: Clashes in Pokrovsk ‚Äì Germany Didn‚Äôt Know Kiev‚Äôs Plans, Solz Says ‚Äì 2024-08-22 22:09:13
text:
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky assured today that Ukrainian forces understand what Moscow is trying to do on the Pokrovsk front, where the Russian army is advancing, and that Kiev is strengthening its forces accordingly in the region.
In his televised address, Zelensky also urged Kiev‚Äôs partners to stick to the agreed timetable for supplying the Ukrainian army with ammunition.
He added that the attack launched by his country in Russia‚Äôs Kursk region on August 6 was continuing and said that the Ukrainians controlled ‚Äúsome areas‚Äù, without elaborating.
Statements from Soltz German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said today that Ukraine had not consulted his country about its August 6 invasion into Russia and that he expected the advance to be limited.
Speaking during a press conference after talks with Moldovan President Maya Sandu in Chisinau, he also said Germany would continue to be Ukraine‚Äôs biggest supporter in Europe.
For her part, Moldovan President Maya Sandu said that Berlin‚Äôs support for her country strengthens neighboring Ukraine and security in the region.
He also said that Moldova is open to investment and invited German businessmen to participate in the country‚Äôs first tender for renewable energy production.
Threats at Russian airports Airports in Russia‚Äôs Arctic Circle cities of Murmansk and Apatity have begun to reopen after a brief airspace closure, civil aviation agency Rosaviatsia said.
Since the start of the war in Ukraine, Russian airports have been frequently shut down due to potential or actual Ukrainian drone attacks.
Murmansk Governor Andrei Tsibis confirmed the drone threat to the region today, but did not provide further details.
Several Russian media outlets later published a video purported to show the downing of a drone in the Murmansk region. Reuters could not immediately verify the authenticity of the video.
In the Murmansk region there is an air base for strategic bombers near the city of Olenegorsk.
